I use Waterfox on GNU/Linux.

Since you can no longer trust Mozilla, I have chosen the free (as in freedom) version Waterfox. Based on Firefox as the name suggests. I do not know if Chromium(the open source version of Google Chrome) spies at the user. Maybe it is also a "good" browser. But I can only advise you against Google Chrome. Especially if you do not want to deal with DRM or trackers.

I use the following addons in my Waterfox:
-> NoScript (THE MOST IMPORTANT)
-> Random Agent Spoofer
-> uBlock Origin
-> Self-Destructing Cookies (less important)

And always remember kidz: The fewer addons, the better!
